snippet: Analysts were already disappointed in the performance of the oil company, which reported a $1.4 billion loss for the second quarter.
abstract: BP reports a $1.4 billion loss for the second quarter, after $4.8 billion in write-downs on refineries, shale gas assets in the United States and a long-delayed project in Alaska wiped out its operating profits.
lead_paragraph: Analysts were already disappointed in the performance of the oil company, which reported a $1.4 billion loss for the second quarter.
